<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\brief Defines various target-specific GPU grid values that must be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///        consistent between host RTL (plugin), device RTL, and clang.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///        We can change grid values for a &quot;fat&quot; binary so that different</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///        passes get the correct values when generating code for a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///        multi-target binary. Both amdgcn and nvptx values are stored in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///        this file. In the future, should there be differences between GPUs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///        of the same architecture, then simply make a different array and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///        use the new array name.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Example usage in clang:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   const unsigned slot&#95;size =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   ctx.GetTargetInfo().getGridValue().GV&#95;Warp&#95;Size;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Example usage in libomptarget/deviceRTLs:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   #include &quot;llvm/Frontend/OpenMP/OMPGridValues.h&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   #ifdef &#95;&#95;AMDGPU&#95;&#95;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     #define GRIDVAL AMDGPUGridValues</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   #else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     #define GRIDVAL NVPTXGridValues</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   #endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   ... Then use this reference for GV&#95;Warp&#95;Size in the deviceRTL source.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   llvm::omp::GRIDVAL().GV&#95;Warp&#95;Size</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Example usage in libomptarget hsa plugin:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   #include &quot;llvm/Frontend/OpenMP/OMPGridValues.h&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   #define GRIDVAL AMDGPUGridValues</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   ... Then use this reference to access GV&#95;Warp&#95;Size in the hsa plugin.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   llvm::omp::GRIDVAL().GV&#95;Warp&#95;Size</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Example usage in libomptarget cuda plugin:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    #include &quot;llvm/Frontend/OpenMP/OMPGridValues.h&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    #define GRIDVAL NVPTXGridValues</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   ... Then use this reference to access GV&#95;Warp&#95;Size in the cuda plugin.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    llvm::omp::GRIDVAL().GV&#95;Warp&#95;Size</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// An alternative to the heavy data sharing infrastructure that uses global</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// memory is one that uses device &#95;&#95;shared&#95;&#95; memory.  The amount of such space</span></CodeLine>
